info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:34PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...SOUTH CENTRAL MERCER...NORTHWESTERN BEAVER...LAWRENCE AND WEST CENTRAL BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 634 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Waterford, or near East Palestine, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... New Castle, Columbiana, East Palestine, Ellwood City, New Wilmington, Oakwood, New Castle Northwest, New Waterford, Big Beaver, New Beaver, Ellport, and Bessemer. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 98 and 104. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 8 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
